qas.question: What is mainly responsible for the connection of the antenna to its end destinations?
What is the group of elements used to join the elements of an antenna?
What are the type of antennas used with satellite television called?
What can be used in place of  a standard transmission line?

context: An <a0_0>antenna lead-in<a0_0/> is the transmission line (or feed line) which connects the antenna to a transmitter or receiver. The <a1_0>antenna feed<a1_0/> may refer to all components connecting the antenna to the transmitter or receiver, such as an impedance matching network in addition to the transmission line. In a so-called <a2_0>aperture antenna<a2_0/>, such as a horn or parabolic dish, the "feed" may also refer to a basic antenna inside the entire system (normally at the focus of the parabolic dish or at the throat of a horn) which could be considered the one active element in that antenna system. A <a3_0>microwave antenna<a3_0/> may also be fed directly from a waveguide in place of a (conductive) transmission line.
